snippet: In his speech on Wednesday, President Obama pressured Republicans in Congress to support his new $302 billion, four-year transportation program.
abstract: Pres Obama, in speech in front of Tappan Zee Bridge, pressures Republicans in Congress to support his new $302 billion, four-year transportation infrastructure program; argues that unless program is passed, current transportation funding will run out later in 2014, endangering many highway, port, bridge and transit projects and jobs.

byline.original: By JOSEPH BERGER and PETER BAKER

lead_paragraph: In his speech on Wednesday, President Obama pressured Republicans in Congress to support his new $302 billion, four-year transportation program.

headline.main: Aging Bridge Behind Him, Obama Pushes Infrastructure Projects
headline.print_headline: Aging Bridge Behind Him, Obama Pushes Infrastructure Projects
